edu.snu.onyx.runtime.executor.data.blocktransfer

Class BlockInputStream<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.snu.onyx.runtime.executor.data.blocktransfer.BlockInputStream<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of element
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    BlockStream, Iterable<T>

    public final class BlockInputStream<T>
extends Object
implements Iterable<T>, BlockStream
    Input stream for block transfer. Decodes and stores inbound data elements from other executors. Three threads are involved.
    • Netty EventLoopGroup receives data from other executors and adds them by append(ByteBuf)
    • BlockTransfer.inboundExecutorService decodes ByteBufs into elements
    • User thread may use Iterator to iterate over this object for their own work.

      • iterator

        public Iterator<T> iterator()
        Returns an Iterator for this Iterable. The end of this Iterable can possibly mean an error during the block transfer. Consider using completeFuture and CompletableFuture.isCompletedExceptionally() to check it.

      • getCompleteFuture

        public CompletableFuture<BlockInputStream<T>> getCompleteFuture()
        Gets a CompletableFuture that completes with the block transfer being done. This future is completed by one of the decoding thread. Consider using separate ExecutorService when chaining a task to this future.
        Returns:
        a CompletableFuture that completes with the block transfer being done
